definition: common/general/to share/together/total/altogether/abbr. for 共產黨|共产党[Gong4 chan3 dang3], Communist party
to go/to visit (e.g. another country)/to attend (a banquet etc)

sentences.english: Receive YuWei flower beauty, want to have dinner together with YuWei.
sentences.chinese: 丽人收到喻威的花，要和喻威一起共赴晚餐。

sentences.english: Say you are invited out by someone you hardly know to a restaurant.
sentences.chinese: 试想有一个你不曾了解的人邀请你共赴晚餐。

sentences.english: Only by joint efforts from all nations of the world can we survive a time of difficulties.
sentences.chinese: 只有通过世界各国的携手努力才能共赴时艰。

sentences.english: I am willing to work with you in the horizon, but is afraid of confidante old feelings, when difficulties as.
sentences.chinese: 我愿与你共赴天涯，却怕红颜老去，几时情愫难消尽。

sentences.english: This weekend, I get a nice Mercedes to take my wife to dinner.
sentences.chinese: 周末，我驾驶一辆奔驰载着我妻子共赴晚宴。

sentences.english: Wanted: Young single woman in need of cut price romantic Caribbean holiday.
sentences.chinese: 寻年轻单身女子，低价共赴加勒比海浪漫之旅。

sentences.english: Wish to hold your hand, to long life.
sentences.chinese: 只愿执子之手，共赴漫漫人生。

sentences.english: The hero of the chivalrous youth similarities, invites, ruler in rivers and Lakes tour.
sentences.chinese: 仗剑好汉，侠义少年，邀君共赴江湖游。

definition: to agree (on a meeting place, date etc)/to reach agreement/to make an appointment
to walk hand in hand/to cooperate
to cooperate on a great undertaking or joint project
to meet by chance/to run into sb/chance encounter
hand in hand and shoulder to shoulder
hand in hand/to join hands/to collaborate
to invite/to request/to intercept/to solicit/to seek
to arrive (esp. of notable person)/to visit (more formal than 光臨|光临[guang1 lin2])
